etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish بیاغی (bayağı), from Proto-Common Turkic *bayakï, from Proto-Turkic *baya (“previously mentioned, recent, former”) + *ok (“emphasis postposition”). Cognate with Azerbaijani bayağı, Kazakh баяғы (baäğy, “same, old”), Southern Altai байагы (bayagï, “recent”), Karakhanid بَیا اُقْ (bayā oq), Uyghur بايا (baya), Uzbek boya, boyagi.
